column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Melody Thomas
#Text=Scott
#Text=:
#Text=I really enjoyed the alcoholism storyline .
#Text=It was very realistic and showed how easily one can get drawn into addiction .
#Text=( She was also mixing her alcohol intake with pain pills ! )
#Text=Perhaps the story was ahead of its time .
#Text=The only thing that flawed it for me was not showing the viewers how she recovered .
#Text=I was really hoping that we could follow her through rehab , counseling , therapy , etc.
#Text=It would have been a riveting glimpse of what she had to go through to get sober but we never saw any of that .
#Text=She simply woke up one morning , sober .
#Text=To this day , I 'm always hoping for her to relapse so that we could finally end that story realistically .
#Text=Michelle Stafford :
#Text=The blackmailing of Dr. Reid .
#Text=That was so creepy and fun and wrong , but it ended up being very funny , [ and ] the Nick/Phyllis affair .
#Text=It was a very real story .
#Text=I like the way it was told .
#Text=It was real .
#Text=It 's also fun to play a secret .
#Text=Tricia Cast :
#Text=" Trying to make a lady out of Nina " was fun .
#Text=I love comedy .
#Text=Mike Halterman : ... which one was your least favorite ?
#Text=Melody Thomas Scott : Although the stripping will forever be imprinted in the viewers ' minds ( especially the men ! ) , I was nervous as a cat each time Nikki performed on stage .
#Text=I am not a good dancer , so I felt very awkward pretending to know what I was doing !
#Text=Even though the show hired amazing choreographers to work with me , I always felt like a fraud !
#Text=Michelle Stafford :
#Text=I did n't have a least favorite .
#Text=That 's my job to make whatever I 'm given good .
#Text=If it comes off – the jury 's out on that – that 's up to the audience .
#Text=Tricia Cast : The " poor Nina " stuff tended to depress me .

column1: #Text=Mike Halterman : If you had the power to bring one past character back to the show , who would you bring back and why ?
#Text=Melody Thomas Scott :
#Text=Selfishly speaking , I would love to have John Enos [ who played Bobby Marsino ] return .
#Text=We had a lot of chemistry on camera and it was a pleasure working with him .
#Text=His character 's not dead , so anything is possible !
#Text=Michelle Stafford :
#Text=I think I would like to bring Diane Jenkins back because we do n't seem to have anyone evil on the show and I think it 's important to have some villains in this medium .
#Text=And Susan [ Walters , who played Diane ] was a great actress .
#Text=Mike Halterman :
#Text=How do you feel about the rise of unscripted shows which indirectly breed dramatic situations , like Big Brother and Starting Over ?
#Text=Do you think the rise of reality programming is " bad for business " as far as the daytime dramas go ?
